p: Caterpillars of both the microlepidopteran P. xylostella and the macrolepidopteran P. brassicae primarily feed on brassicaceous plant species and are important pests of cruciferous crops (Feltwell 1982, Furlong et al. 2013). Caterpillars of both species were obtained from the laboratory of Entomology, Wageningen University and were originally collected in cabbage fields near Wageningen. They were maintained on cabbage plants ( Brassica oleracea, var. gemmifera, cv. Cyrus) in climate rooms at 22° ± 2°C, 50–70% relative humidity and a photoperiod of 16 h.
